employments.summary: - Tracked psychosocial phenomena from social media across time and space to predict health outcomes and personality (wwbp.org)

- Managed full technical stack: frontend, backend, load-testing, and distribution
- Recruited and managed technical team
- Personally raised $30,000 in seed funding
- Developed an open-source R package “BTYD” that predicts customers’ non-contractual purchasing behavior: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/BTYD/index.html

- Designed and implemented the application backend used to build psychometric profiles for end users (R and Python)
- Built an interpersonal friendship ML algorithm (R) that analyzes whether two individuals are likely to be amicable
- Managed the technical infrastructure (Tornado and Cassandra backend with web app) of the company, ensuring scalability and reliability

- Prototyped, co-developed, and co-productionized search ranking algorithm (Hive Streaming, Python, and R), matching inquiries with listings, resulting in incremental nights booked expected to translate to more than $100M in revenue in 2015
- Prototyped and productionized a scalable, real-time predictive model scoring service (R, Python, and Java)
- Productionized and maintained shiny-server (automated deployment on AWS Chef), Airbnb’s current reporting tool
- Developed infrastructure enabling our team to use Mahout for distributed LDA, Logistic Regression, SSVD
- Predicted intent to contact combining site activity with PCA on tf-idf normalized web requests in a random forest

http://nerds.airbnb.com/host-preferences/
http://nerds.airbnb.com/architecting-machine-learning-system-risk/
http://techcrunch.com/2014/12/11/framed-data-seed/?utm_content=buffer54d08&utm_medium=social&utm_source=linkedin.com&utm_campaign=buffer

- Enabling rapid prototyping, QA’ing, and application of quantitative methods to new and existing data
- Mined text to predict financials and to find relevant contributing factors to financial success
- Building scalable, hands-off predictive modeling infrastructure for lead generation and ranking

educations.degree: BS, Operations Research and Computer Analysis

offers.message:
Lukasz,
Thanks for using our platform! I am the Head of Data Science at Hired. We are a growing very rapidly and just about getting started building out our data science team. The growth has been really exciting in the last year with $15M each in Series A and B rounds, 3-4x revenue growth and headcount growth from 50 to 150 and currently on a $40M run rate. Projected to be $100M+ next year.

There is potential to have a really significant impact on the business as we scale. Specifically we are building machine learning algorithms for recommendations, search relevance, automatic curation, business process automation and more.

Your background makes you an ideal fit for us. I would love to have an opportunity to tell you more.

-Parshu
offers.comment:
Hi Parshu!

I didn't think that you guys would be hiring through your platform as well..  that makes a lot of sense :)

My account just got activated Monday and I am flying away to Michigan for a week so I won't be available but I would definitely like to hear more about your team as soon as I can. I will be back next wednesday.
offers.disposition_notes: 8/25 #signed Aug #contract #paper getting details now. Starts monday, waiting on people 2.0

offers.message:
Hi Lukasz,   

For this position you can work from a remote location - I am not clear on how to change the location of the position on Hired. 

I work as a Sr. Data Scientist at Circleup a marketplace for private investing in consumer companies. We are funded by Google Ventures/Union Square among others and are looking for a foundational member for the Data Science team.   

We are working on challenging problems in information retrieval and being able to develop an in-depth knowledge graph of all private companies. We want to be able to understand the information around us to see how and why entrepreneurs and entrepreneurial enterprises succeed at a early stage. 

Below are also a couple of good articles we have received about the data science work we are doing at Circleup with Fast company and the Wall Street journal.  
1) http://www.fastcompany.com/3057844/when-data-not-humans-guide-vc-funding-more-women-win  
2) https://s3.amazonaws.com/static-circleup-com/wsj+article.pdf.   

We are mining vast amounts of data to successfully rewrite the rules on how private companies are evaluated. This role would also be in a position to build new ways to asses the credit worthiness of private businesses. You can read a little bit more about our Data Science work here - https://circleup.com/classifier/.   

I would love to connect with you on this and see if this is interesting to you. Please let me know. Thanks!
offers.comment: This is an incredibly exciting opportunity! I will be away in Michigan until next Wednesday; let's connect when I get back.
offers.search_content: Lukasz Dziurzynski Senior Data Scientist 150000.00 Competetive
offers.disposition_notes: Phone interview (update pulled 7/25). Client unresponsive, please FU #CE 7/19 ~ 2nd FU to client 07/07 ~ scheduler FU’d w/cand 7/1 ~ Hashing out a time after next Wed 6/29

offers.message:
Hi Lukasz,

I wanted to connect with you about the open Senior Data Scientist role here at Lumosity. 

Lumosity is the leader in the cognitive wellness space, and our cognitive training games have been played over 3 billion times. 

Our data science team works cross-functionally with our product, marketing and science teams to build data-driven product features for our users, develop internal models and analytical tools to help us predict customer value and guide product development and experimentation, and support our R&D efforts and scientific collaborations. For more info on what our team does, check out the Quora post one of our team members recently published:

https://www.quora.com/How-does-Lumosity-use-data-science

This year we’re making a major product investment in providing insights about cognitive performance and its link to the real world back to our users in the form of product features, and we’re expecting that this person would be key to driving this effort and making it successful. 

Please let me know if you’re interested in learning more and we can find a time to discuss further!

Best,
Bella
offers.comment:
HELLO!

I am very interested in cognitive wellness and subscribed to Luminosity very early on. My first volunteer opportunity after graduation was with the Positive Psychology Center at Penn and I have related long term plans.

I have time this afternoon (860.389.2232) and next Friday. Send me a text if you are interested.
offers.search_content: Lukasz Dziurzynski Senior Data Scientist 180000.00 Generous
offers.disposition_notes: 1st round ph iv 7/15 1:15p PT (7/12) ~ scheduler FU’d w/client 7/11

profile.headline: Data Scientist with UPenn Math degree working on modeling for lead generation and financials text mining; created Airbnb search ranking algorithm
profile.summary:
I am a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania with a Bachelors in Mathematics. I am currently a Data Scientist at 6Sense and Quantified.  

**Projects & Accolades**
- Presented Search Ranking Algorithm at I FORS 2014 in Barcelona on behalf of Airbnb
- Undefeated Airbnb forecasting champion, predicting Dec. 31 bookings within 1% and a milestone in active listings within one day
- 3D Skype using multiple Microsoft Kinect Cameras, 3-Player Chess, and NUI Jenga using Kinect
profile.job_search_reason: Would like to live in Sacramento and work remotely, I am tired of San Francisco.
